isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - TROUBLESHOOTING (INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHT DIAGNOSTICS) - ENGINE WARN

entry.para: Disconnect ECM connector (379) and use a test jumper to connect pin 55/circuit 97TA to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (379), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove engine warn warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (379), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97T to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97T, connector (3), circuit 97T or circuit 97TA, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28K to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28K from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (379), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (379).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Disconnect ECM connector (1091) and use a test jumper to connect pin 25 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (1091), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove engine warn warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (1091), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97AT to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AT, connector (333), circuit 97AT, connector (3), or circuit 97AT, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28K to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28K from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (1091), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (1091).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.

svcsubproc.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins M11E Plus or N14E Plus

table.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins M11E Plus or N14E Plus

entry.para: Disconnect ECM connector (320) and use a test jumper to connect pin 25 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (320), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove engine warn warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (320), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97AT to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AT, connector (333), circuit 97AT, connector (3), or circuit 97AT, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28K to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28K from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (320), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (320).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.

entry.para: Disconnect ECM connector (534) and use a test jumper to connect pin 22 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (534), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove engine warn warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (534), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97AT to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AT, connector (333), circuit 97AT, connector (3), or circuit 97AT, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28K to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28K from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (534), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (534).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Disconnect ECM connector (379) and use a test jumper to connect pin 55/circuit 97T to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (379), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove engine warn warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (10), and with jumper still attached at connector (379), measure resistance from connector (10) circuit 97T to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97T, connector (15), or circuit 97T, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (10) circuit 28K to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28K from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (379), reconnect connector (10). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (379).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Disconnect ECM connector (379) and use a test jumper to connect pin 55 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (379), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove engine warn warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (12), and with jumper still attached at connector (379), measure resistance from connector (12) circuit 97T to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97T, connector (198), or circuit 97T, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (12) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (379), reconnect connector (12). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (379).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
